title: Copy/Export solved meal plan
description: Add a 'Copy to clipboard' button that produces a clean text summary of the solved meal plan: ingredient names + gram quantities + key macros. Optionally include micronutrient coverage summary. Bridges the gap between planning and doing — without this, users must manually transcribe solver output. Could also support a print-friendly view. Button should appear in the results panel near the totals section.

title: Add sodium tracking to micronutrients
description: Add sodium (Na) to the 20 tracked micronutrients. USDA nutrient ID 1093 likely already present in food data. Add to Major Minerals tier with DRI/UL values (UL: 2300mg, AI: 1500mg). Include in solver optimization, UL enforcement, and frontend micronutrient coverage bars. Low effort, high payoff — fills a genuine nutritional blind spot using data already available in the USDA database.

title: Add LLM-scored commonness ranking to food database
description:
Add a 'commonness' score (1-5) to each food in foods.json, generated by Claude Haiku at build time, to weight ingredient search results toward everyday foods.

## Problem
- 4,840 foods in DB, ~455 (10%) are dried/dehydrated/powder/canned variants
- Search sorts alphabetically + gap score with no normalness weighting
- 'Dried Egg' appears above 'Egg (Grade A, large)' when searching 'egg'

## Implementation
1. **Build script** (scripts/build_food_db.py): Add generate_commonness() function parallel to generate_names(). Batch 50 foods per Haiku call. Prompt: rate 1-5 how commonly a typical grocery shopper would buy each food (5=everyday staple, 3=normal but less frequent, 1=specialty/obscure). Cache in commonness_cache.json (resumable, same pattern as name_cache.json).
2. **Data** (foods.json): Add 'commonness' integer field (1-5) per food entry.
3. **Frontend** (AddIngredientModal.svelte): Update search sort to factor in commonness. Hard tier for default/no-query listing (commonness desc > gap score desc). Soft blend when user is actively searching (nameStartsWithQuery > commonness desc > gap score desc).

## Cost
- ~97 Haiku calls (one-time, cached)
- One integer field per food — negligible size increase
close_reason: Implemented commonness ranking, excluded spices/flour, fixed solver overflow

title: Swap ingredient: suggest replacements ranked by commonness and nutritional similarity
description: Add a 'swap' action to each ingredient row that opens a modal suggesting replacement foods. Replacements should be ranked by how well they fill a similar nutritional profile to the food being swapped, weighted by commonness score. For example, swapping out salmon should suggest other high-omega/protein foods like chicken breast or tuna, preferring everyday staples (high commonness) over obscure items. The modal should show the nutritional delta (what you gain/lose) for each suggestion.

title: Save/Load named meal configurations
description: Allow users to save the current configuration (ingredients, ranges, constraints, pinned meals, calorie target, macro ratios, demographics) as a named preset and load any saved preset to restore full state. Enables quick-switching between plans like 'Cutting 1800 kcal', 'Maintenance 2500 kcal', etc. Currently only one state exists in localStorage — this turns the app from a calculator into a daily planning tool. Storage: localStorage with a list of named configs.

title: Revisit ingredient search sort tiebreaking
description: Gap score ties between foods with similar micronutrient contributions are broken arbitrarily.
